familyMemberEthics.description: Ivanka Trump received $2,501 - $5,000 and None (or less than $201) in (income type not disclosed) income via two transactions from A&Q LONG/SHORT STRATEGIES FUND LLC the year before her appointment as her father's presidential adviser. In the latter transaction, a promissory note arising from a divestment was to be repaid by the first quarter of 2018. Value of payment fixed as of divestment. Filer and her family lack control over, and knowledge of, the underlying assets held by the portfolio funds that the fund has invested in. This potential conflict of interest is marked as active pending confirmation that the promissory note has been paid.
Jared Kushner received $0 - $200 in (income type not disclosed) income UBS RMA Government Money Market Fund (RMGXX) the year before his appointment as Pres. Trump's senior adviser.
familyMemberEthics.business: UBS RMA Government Money Market Fund (RMGXX)
